duck: Motion (parliamentary procedure), a formal proposal by a member of a deliberative assembly that the assembly take certain action
Motion (legal), a procedural device in law to bring a limited, contested matter before a court
Motion (democracy), a formal step to introduce a matter for consideration by a group
Motion (physics), any movement or change in position or time
motion definition: an act, process, or instance of changing place.
Motion (American football), a movement by an offensive player prior to the start of a play
Motion (geometry), a type of transformation in various geometrical studies

wiki.text:
'Motion' may refer to:
* Motion (physics), any movement or change in position or time

* Motion (legal), a procedural device in law to bring a limited, contested
  matter before a court
* Motion (democracy), a formal step to introduce a matter for consideration
  by a group
* Motion (parliamentary procedure), a formal proposal by a member of a
  deliberative assembly that the assembly take certain action
* Motion (American football), a movement by an offensive player prior to the
  start of a play
* Motion (geometry), a type of transformation in various geometrical studies
* Motion, the connecting rods and valve-gear of a steam locomotive
wiki.title: Motion
